Welcome to hyperbolic’s documentation!¶

hyperbolic is the companion code to the paper XXX.

Contents:

Running the paper’s experiments¶

The main class implements a complete experiment.

class hyperbolic.Experiment(expId='demo', N=1024, M=100000, alpha=0.0, A=5)¶

Sample an analytic white noise, compute its AWT, and look up its zeros.

expId – a string identifying a particular experiment, used for saving results.

N – the length of the discretized signal.

M – the truncation level for the GAF.

alpha – parameter for Paul’s wavelet.

A – bound of the observation window [-A,A].

sampleWhiteNoise()¶

Sample realization of white noise.

performAWT()¶

Perform analytic wavelet transform.

findZeros(th=0.01)¶

Find zeros as local minima that are below a threshold

plotResults(boolShow=False)¶

Plot and save spectrum, signal, and scalogram

A complete example¶

Simply run examples/example1.py, which contains

import sys
sys.path.append("../hyperbolic")
import hyperbolic as hype

xp = hype.Experiment(alpha=2.0) # initialize experiment, you can play with the parameters, hit shift+TAB for details
xp.sampleWhiteNoise()
xp.performAWT()
xp.findZeros()
xp.plotResults(boolShow=0)

The output should be
